title: Famous Statues
description: Recall facts about famous statues and monuments

questions.question: Which colossal statue overlooking Rio de Janeiro stands atop Corcovado Mountain, is 30 meters tall, and depicts a religious figure with outstretched arms?
Which famous copper statue was a gift from France to the United States in 1886, stands on Liberty Island, and holds a torch and a tablet inscribed with a date?
Which ancient Greek marble sculpture, currently in the Louvre Museum, depicts a winged female figure and was discovered on the island of Samothrace in 1863?
Which Renaissance marble statue by Michelangelo, standing over 14 feet tall, depicts a biblical hero before his battle with Goliath and is housed in Florence?
Which bronze sculpture by Auguste Rodin shows a seated nude male figure resting his chin on his hand, deep in contemplation?
Which ancient limestone monument in Egypt has the body of a lion and the head of a human, and has guarded the Giza pyramid complex for over 4,500 years?
Which group of nearly 1,000 mysterious stone statues, called moai, were carved by the Rapa Nui people on a remote island in the southeastern Pacific Ocean?
Which seated marble statue in Washington, D.C., depicts the 16th President of the United States inside a Greek temple-style memorial?
Which colossal monument in South Dakota features the carved faces of four U.S. presidents — Washington, Jefferson, Roosevelt, and Lincoln — on a granite cliff?
Which small bronze statue in Copenhagen, Denmark, sits on a rock by the waterside and was inspired by a fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen?
Which ancient Greek statue, now in the Louvre, depicts the goddess Aphrodite and is famous for its missing arms?
Which massive statue in Volgograd, Russia, commemorates the Battle of Stalingrad, depicts a woman raising a sword, and stands 85 meters tall?
options: Monument to the Conquerors of Space

questions.question: Which 20-meter-tall steel sculpture of an angel with outstretched wings stands beside a motorway in Gateshead, England, and was designed by Antony Gormley?
Which bronze statue of a small boy urinating into a fountain is a famous landmark and symbol of the city of Brussels, Belgium?
Which Michelangelo sculpture in St. Peter's Basilica in Vatican City depicts the Virgin Mary holding the body of Jesus after the Crucifixion?
